INNOVATIONS AECOM'S SCIENCE INFRASTRUCTURE NEWSLETTER - 01
Science Infrastructure - are we doing enough? Last week's Budget presented an ideal opportunity for the Chancellor to maximise the PR for a long-term government commitment to investment in science infrastructure. The intrinsic link between the UK's international pedigree in highly accomplished scientific research, and the commercial catalyst to driving the country's economic engine is a now well-adopted political mantra. These would have been easy points for the Chancellor in re-outlining the UK's reputation as the international destination of choice for research and development. On Site Synchrotron sources, including the Diamond Light Source at Harwell Oxford produce beams of light across a large energy range. They are used across a wide scope of research areas from biological crystallography, to heritage science, environmental science and engineering. The UK has reclaimed its position at the state-of-the-art in this area with the success of Diamond - the opportunity now exists to move into a real position of international leadership.
